guardians.webapp.controllers

Class ScheduleController

  • java.lang.Object
    • guardians.webapp.controllers.ScheduleController

  • @Controller
 @RequestMapping(value="/schedules")
public class ScheduleController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is reponsible for handling requests related to Calendars and their associated Schedules
    Author:
    miggoncan

    • Method Detail

      • getSchedulesSummary

        @GetMapping(value="")
public java.lang.String getSchedulesSummary(org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        This method handles requests to get a summarized list of the existent Schedules in the application. This summarized list includes the month and year of the schedule, and their status.
        Parameters:
        model - The model object that will be used to pass attributes to thymeleaf
        Returns:
        The path to the thymeleaf template used to represent the schedules list (The path is relative to resources/templates and does not contain the file extension)

      • getSchedule

        @GetMapping(value="/{yearMonth}")
public java.lang.String getSchedule(@PathVariable
                                                                      java.time.YearMonth yearMonth,
                                                                      @RequestParam(defaultValue="false")
                                                                      java.lang.Boolean useListView,
                                                                      org.springframework.ui.Model model)

      • newScheduleForm

        @GetMapping(value="/new")
public java.lang.String newScheduleForm(@RequestParam
                                                                  java.time.YearMonth yearMonth,
                                                                  org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        This method handles requests to get the form used to generate a new Schedule
        Parameters:
        yearMonth - The year and month for which the schedule is to be generated
        model - The model object that will be used to pass attributes to thymeleaf
        Returns:
        The path to the thymeleaf template form to generate a Schedule (The path is relative to resources/templates and does not contain the file extension)

      • newSchedule

        @PostMapping(value="/new")
 @ResponseBody
public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> newSchedule(@RequestParam
                                                                                                              java.time.YearMonth yearMonth,
                                                                                                              @RequestBody
                                                                                                              java.util.List<DayConfiguration> dayConfs)
        This method handles requests to generate a new Schedule
        Parameters:
        yearMonth - The year and month for which the schedule is to be generated
        Returns:
        A Map that should be serialized into JSON. It will contain the key: SCHEDULE_HREF whose value will be the URI where the schedule information will be shown (A GET to this URI will return html content).

      • confirmSchedule

        @PostMapping(value="/{yearMonth}/confirm")
public java.lang.String confirmSchedule(@PathVariable
                                                                                   java.time.YearMonth yearMonth,
                                                                                   org.springframework.ui.Model model)
